result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Case called: 9:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears in custody, pro se. 
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 

COURT discusses counsel with deft as Atty Wallace has recently been appointed. 
Deft wishes to speak with counsel before proceeding with preliminary hearing. 

COURT resets prelim to 7/13/22 at 10:00 a.m., Branch 4.

COURT finds good cause to extend time limits.  

Defendant requests to address no contact with sister; sister is present today. 
ADA Marschall is not prepared to proceed today but will make note to address at next prelim. 

Adj: 9:05 a.m. 

cc: Branch 5.
Request to appear remotely
Atty John Wallace
Preliminary Hearing on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:06 pm. 

Deft appears via video, in custody, pro se.  
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed. 
Deft. wishes to proceed to preliminary hearing without counsel.
Deft. questions bond modification. Court advises to put request in writing to Judge.
Prelim set for 07/05/2022 to remain on calendar. 

Adj: 1:08 pm.

Review hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:02 pm.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Adam Fontana and Krista Cannon.
Date and time set for IA; VRCW.

Reading Waived.  Reserved Jurisdiction.
Court questions deft re complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.

Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

B.A.T. makes a statement.

COURT ORDERS: $5,000 cash bond -- CONDITIONS:
- No contact with victim(s): K.D.T. or residence.  B.A.T. (can have contact for sole purpose of finance, nothing further) or J.L.T. or residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

>> FUTURE DATES:

PH: 7/5 at 9 in B
